intro: Elatostema multicaule, commonly known as the clustered elatostema, is a small herbaceous plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettles and related plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understoreys. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a distinctive waxy coating. Elatostema multicaule produces small greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found in association with other understory flora.
